events.name: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Visit to Kyiv
events.wd_label: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Visit to Kyiv
events.wd_description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visited Kyiv, pledging continued support for Ukraine and announcing a new £50 million air defense package to help counter Russian drone attacks.
events.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak visited Kyiv, pledging continued support for Ukraine and announcing a new £50 million air defense package to help counter Russian drone attacks.

events.name: Sunak's Visit to Kyiv
events.wd_description: Rishi Sunak made his first visit to Kyiv as the UK Prime Minister, reaffirming Britain's support for Ukraine and emphasizing the UK's commitment to standing with Ukraine.
events.description: Rishi Sunak made his first visit to Kyiv as the UK Prime Minister, reaffirming Britain's support for Ukraine and emphasizing the UK's commitment to standing with Ukraine.

events.name: New Air Defense Package
events.wd_description: Sunak announced a £50 million ($60 million) package, including anti-aircraft guns and radar technology, to help Ukraine defend against Russian drone attacks.
events.description: Sunak announced a £50 million ($60 million) package, including anti-aircraft guns and radar technology, to help Ukraine defend against Russian drone attacks.

events.name: Continued UK Support for Ukraine
events.wd_description: The UK pledged to increase the training provided to Ukrainian armed forces, reinforcing its ongoing support for Ukraine's defense efforts.
events.description: The UK pledged to increase the training provided to Ukrainian armed forces, reinforcing its ongoing support for Ukraine's defense efforts.

events.name: UK Inflation Hits New High in October Due to Rising Energy Costs
events.wd_label: UK Inflation Hits New High in October Due to Rising Energy Costs
events.wd_description: The UK's inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, driven by soaring energy costs, as the economy slides into recession, with living costs sharply increasing despite government intervention.
events.description: The UK's inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, driven by soaring energy costs, as the economy slides into recession, with living costs sharply increasing despite government intervention.

events.name: Inflation Increase
events.wd_description: The UK's annual inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, up from 10.1% in September, marking a new high driven by rising energy and food prices.
events.description: The UK's annual inflation rate rose to 11.1% in October, up from 10.1% in September, marking a new high driven by rising energy and food prices.

events.name: Energy Price Surge
events.wd_description: Soaring gas and electricity prices, with gas prices rising nearly 130% and electricity by 66%, have significantly contributed to the sharp increase in the cost of living.
events.description: Soaring gas and electricity prices, with gas prices rising nearly 130% and electricity by 66%, have significantly contributed to the sharp increase in the cost of living.

events.name: Economic Recession Projection
events.wd_description: The UK economy is projected to remain in recession through the first quarter of 2024, as confirmed by recent data showing economic contraction in the third quarter.
events.description: The UK economy is projected to remain in recession through the first quarter of 2024, as confirmed by recent data showing economic contraction in the third quarter.

events.name: Ukraine Faces Russian Attacks as NATO and Poland Investigate Missile Crash
events.wd_label: Ukraine Faces Russian Attacks as NATO and Poland Investigate Missile Crash
events.wd_description: Ukraine faced renewed Russian attacks in the east as NATO and Poland concluded that a missile crash in Poland, which killed two people, was likely caused by a stray Ukrainian air defense missile.
events.description: Ukraine faced renewed Russian attacks in the east as NATO and Poland concluded that a missile crash in Poland, which killed two people, was likely caused by a stray Ukrainian air defense missile.

events.name: Russian Attacks in Eastern Ukraine
events.wd_description: Ukraine confirmed fierce attacks in the east by Russian forces, which were reinforced with troops withdrawn from Kherson, following intense strikes on civilian infrastructure.
events.description: Ukraine confirmed fierce attacks in the east by Russian forces, which were reinforced with troops withdrawn from Kherson, following intense strikes on civilian infrastructure.

events.name: Missile Crash in Poland
events.wd_description: A missile crash at a grain facility in Poland, near the Ukrainian border, killed two people, marking the first deadly extension of the war into NATO territory.
events.description: A missile crash at a grain facility in Poland, near the Ukrainian border, killed two people, marking the first deadly extension of the war into NATO territory.

events.name: NATO and Poland's Conclusion
events.wd_description: NATO and Poland concluded that the missile was likely a stray S-300 rocket fired by Ukraine's air defenses, with no evidence suggesting it was launched by Russia.
events.description: NATO and Poland concluded that the missile was likely a stray S-300 rocket fired by Ukraine's air defenses, with no evidence suggesting it was launched by Russia.

events.name: White House Allocation of $2.8 Billion for EV Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_label: White House Allocation of $2.8 Billion for EV Battery Supply Chain
events.wd_description: The White House announced $2.8 billion in grants to build a domestic EV battery supply chain as part of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, targeting projects in 12 states.
events.description: The White House announced $2.8 billion in grants to build a domestic EV battery supply chain as part of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, targeting projects in 12 states.

events.name: Funding Distribution
events.wd_description: The funding is allocated to 20 battery manufacturing and raw-materials processing companies for projects across 12 states, including several red states.
events.description: The funding is allocated to 20 battery manufacturing and raw-materials processing companies for projects across 12 states, including several red states.

events.name: Goals for Lithium Graphite and Nickel Supply
events.wd_label: Goals for Lithium Graphite and Nickel Supply
events.wd_description: The funding aims to develop enough lithium supply for 2 million EVs annually, graphite supply for 1.2 million EVs annually, and nickel supply for 400,000 EVs annually.
events.description: The funding aims to develop enough lithium supply for 2 million EVs annually, graphite supply for 1.2 million EVs annually, and nickel supply for 400,000 EVs annually.

events.name: Expansion of Manufacturing Infrastructure
events.wd_description: Grants will fund expanded refinement and manufacturing infrastructure, including the first commercial-scale lithium electrolyte salt production facility, silicon oxide production facilities, and a lithium iron phosphate cathode facility in the U.S.
events.description: Grants will fund expanded refinement and manufacturing infrastructure, including the first commercial-scale lithium electrolyte salt production facility, silicon oxide production facilities, and a lithium iron phosphate cathode facility in the U.S.

events.name: Additional Bipartisan Infrastructure Law Initiatives
events.wd_description: The law also includes $7.5 billion for a national EV charging network and additional funds from the Energy Department and the Defense Production Act to bolster battery materials.
events.description: The law also includes $7.5 billion for a national EV charging network and additional funds from the Energy Department and the Defense Production Act to bolster battery materials.
